course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Environmental and Energy Governance in China
course.description: This course provides an overview and a systematic discussion of China’s major environmental and energy issues, examining the evolution and effectiveness of China’s environmental governance and environmental policies during a period of rapid economic growth and social and political transformation. The course also analyzes the driving determinants that affect policy implementation outcomes. Students benefit from environmental and energy background and knowledge of China’s political institution and economy.

reviews.author: LouisLaw
reviews.comment_content: If you are really interested in knowing more about china's environmental policies, related figures and the governance part,you should take this course as it provides you with a very comprehensive content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Unfavourable accent,wooden word-by-word teaching,terrible tutorial for the projects,random iprs and group discussion in lectures to check your attendance,
but she is quite willing to answer your questions and I can tell she is really care about the environment of China from her action.
reviews.comment_grading:
The marking of the projects is quite lenient,I just prepare the presentation at the midnight before the presentation day,and I get nearly a full mark even though I just read out the words in the powerpoint.
For the exams,there is MC and LQ.The MC part is just testing did you revise the lecture notes thoroughly.For the LQ part,I just use my knowledge acquired in highschool and some common sense.
So my two projects get near a full mark,my midterm score above mean not even a SD,and my final got about 30 out of 100,but I still got a C+ eventually.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of the course is quite reasonable to me
There is midterm and final.
Two projects,both of them require you to collect 6 questionaires outside of the campus with your groupmates and do a presentation,the one who present can get a higher mark in the project.

reviews.author: aaronkowk1996
reviews.comment_content:
講中國ge environmental problems
其實中學ls好多教過
有好多都係common sense
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂有video睇
但係好多時都係講ppt
好悶
有時會無lala問問題
reviews.comment_grading:
mean左右有b-
midterm final都係mc+short q
睇下d ppt都已經夠做
最麻煩係上堂有時會有PRS question
會有in class discussion,仲要計分

reviews.author: Chloewhy
reviews.comment_content:
讀中國enviroment既污染情況, 同埋不同既相關機構同措施, 不會太深入, 唔洗死記
仲會有好多圖表睇, 但係都係簡單既
reviews.comment_teaching:
照讀ppt, 上堂係悶的, 但唔緊要, instructor 英文都ok
間中會有video clip
reviews.comment_workload:
要做group project同問卷, 有d煩
仲成日突擊take attendance, 又有group discussion, 好易會miss 左
midterm & final mc為主 , 不太難

reviews.author: Crystal Chau
reviews.comment_content: Basically about the energy governance in China, which covers mainly about the pollution problems in China and how to cope with the issues with different policies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures were quite dull, as she was just reading out most of the slides with a tiny bit of elaboration. Besides, the instructor's pronunciation may be difficult to understand, although she tried her best to make everyone attentive.
reviews.comment_grading:
You could get good grades if you are able to recite all of her slides, which is around 4x slides per presentation, 21 presentations in total. If you are the type of person who doesn't like reciting, then do not take this course as it requires a lot of memorizing.

Project grading would be pretty decent if you are able to present your project fluently and confidently.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Mid-term ; 1 Finals.
Two projects in total.
Each project requires you to conduct surveys in public areas other than HKUST. And you have to fulfill its requirement such as finding different ages of interviewees in order to get full mark in your individual part.

You basically have to attend every lesson as she randomly uses iprs.

reviews.author: zoeyingso
reviews.title: Need to recite all details
reviews.comment_content:
Environmental and Energy Governance in China.
More likely the policies and current projects, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pronunciation may be hard to understand, but the professor tries her best to make everyone attended.
reviews.comment_grading: You can get good grades in mid term and final, if you recite all the details in the powerpoint, which consists of around 40 pages per file.
reviews.comment_workload: There are two projects, which require the distributions of surveys and group interpretation of the datas, but questionnaires should not be done in hkust, instead, 4 different age groups, 4 different individual income groups, 4 different household income groups, 4 different education levels, and 1 car owner should be involved in 6 survey samples.
